meanings.definition: To mark or designate with an obelus.
meanings.sent1: She was obelizing the important sections in her textbook.
meanings.sent2: The teacher obelized the key points for the students to remember.
meanings.sent3: While obelizing the errors, he accidentally marked the correct answers too.
meanings.sent4: The editor obelized the controversial statements in the article.
meanings.sent5: He obelized the crucial information with bright red ink.

meanings.definition: To criticize or point out errors in a text.
meanings.sent1: The professor was obelizing the grammar mistakes in the essay.
meanings.sent2: She obelized the inconsistencies in the report.
meanings.sent3: He couldn't resist obelizing the spelling errors in the novel.
meanings.sent4: The reviewer obelized the lack of evidence in the research paper.
meanings.sent5: They were obelizing the plot holes in the movie script.

meanings.definition: To highlight or draw attention to something.
meanings.sent1: The artist was obelizing the beauty of the sunset in her painting.
meanings.sent2: The presenter obelized the importance of recycling in his speech.
meanings.sent3: She obelized the delicious desserts on the menu.
meanings.sent4: The tour guide obelized the historical significance of the monument.
meanings.sent5: He obelized the safety precautions before starting the experiment.
